alert.note: Alert for Newton (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 9:06PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Newton and southeastern Boone Counties through 945 PM CST... At 906 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area, or 18 miles southwest of Jasper, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper... Western Grove... Valley Springs... Olvey... Carver... Erbie... Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area... Lost Valley State Park... Piercetown... Walnut... Pruitt... Bellefonte... Bass... Marble Falls... Yardelle... Fallsville... Crossroad... Swain... Gum Springs in Newton County... Gaither... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for western and north central Arkansas.
